channel.title: JavaScript Weekly
channel.description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects

item.title: „ÄêHow Remix is shaking things up„ÄëÊ∑∑Èü≥Â¶Ç‰ΩïÊëáÂä®
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã738 ‚Äî May 30, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Wake Up, Remix! Everything's Changing.. ‚Äî Big news from the Remix camp this week. About a year ago, Remix and React Router merged together reflecting their shared goals and code, but now it‚Äôs all change again. React Router is now basically what Remix originally intended to be, and so ‚ÄòRemix‚Äô is rebooting as a model-first, low-dependency, Web API-centric full-stack framework built on Preact. It‚Äôll no longer be a 'React framework' per¬†se.

Michael Jackson and Ryan Florence

üïí¬†The Upcoming Temporal API and What Problems It Will Solve ‚Äî The Temporal API has been cooking for many years now as a new way to work with dates and times in JavaScript. It‚Äôs just been enabled in Firefox 139 by default and sure to come to more runtimes ASAP. Here‚Äôs why it matters and what it¬†offers.

Suren Enfiajyan

CodeRabbit‚Äôs Free AI Code Reviews in IDE - VS Code, Cursor, Windsurf ‚Äî Code Rabbit brings AI code reviews to VS Code, Cursor & Windsurf. Get line-by-line reviews, one-click fixes & codebase-aware feedback - all free in your IDE. Seamlessly integrates with git workflows. Install the extension & start¬†reviewing!

CodeRabbit sponsor

Announcing Angular v20 ‚Äî A big release for the Google backed framework where a lot of the more recent experimental features (like signals and incremental hydration) have received a lot of polish and been promoted as stable. There are new experimental APIs too, including resource streaming and httpResource for making HTTP requests with a signal-based reactive¬†API.

Minko Gechev

üí° While the official release post (above) is packed with content, you might appreciate this brief magic-themed roundup of what's new in Angular¬†20.

IN BRIEF:

  • Matteo Collina has unveiled php-node, a way to run PHP apps within the same process as Node.js. Run WordPress with a Next.js frontend?¬†Sure.

  • TC39's 108th meeting is currently taking place with many proposals being advanced, such as Seeded Pseudo-Random Numbers moving to stage 2 and Error.isError moving to stage¬†4.

  • The OpenJS Foundation is now a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA) for over 40 popular JavaScript projects it hosts, including ESLint, Express, and¬†Electron.

  • Node's technical steering committee has decided against instituting an official bounty program.

RELEASES:

  • Bun v1.2.15 ‚Äì Gains a bun audit tool for performing security audits of project¬†dependencies.

  • Ink 6.0 ‚Äì Use React to build CLI¬†apps. Now supporting React¬†19.

  • Docusaurus v3.8 ‚Äì Popular docs-oriented static site generator.

  • Ember 6.4, JSPM 4.0

üìñ¬† Articles

Why Are 2025/05/28 and 2025-05-28 Different Days in JavaScript? ‚Äî An interesting ‚ÄòWat‚Äô-like moment in just the first few lines of this post, which Brandon decided to dig into and¬†explain.

Brandon Dong

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Modern Performance Debugging in Chrome DevTools ‚Äî Paul shares a look at the reimagined Chrome DevTools Performance panel, showing off new features, how they work, and how to use them to make performance¬†gains.

Paul Irish

Build an LMS SaaS App from Scratch ‚Äî Learn to build a production-ready AI SaaS using Next.js with auth, billing, and an AI voice¬†agent.

Clerk sponsor

React, Visualized: A Visual Exploration of React Concepts ‚Äî The creators of a React course have updated their popular visual explainer of numerous core React concepts to cover React 19 and features like actions, transitions, and Server Components¬†too.

Tyler McGinnis et al.

‚ñ∂¬†¬†The 3 Ways JavaScript Frameworks Render the DOM ‚Äî The creator of the SolidJS framework looks at the different approaches frameworks take to render what they produce. A good look under the hood that isn‚Äôt too complex. (16¬†minutes.)

Ryan Carniato

Build a Blog with Angular in Under 30 Minutes Using Analog ‚Äî Analog is a meta-framework for Angular (think along the lines of Next.js or¬†Nuxt).

Peter Mbanugo

Your React Meta-Framework Feels Broken, Here's Why ‚Äî ‚ÄúSometimes you‚Äôve got to burn it all down, start from ash, and rebuild from first principles. This is what we did with¬†RedwoodSDK.‚Äù

Redwood Team

üìÑ No Server, No Database: Smarter Related Posts in Astro with Transformers.js Alexander Opalic

üìÑ A Thought on JavaScript 'Proof of Work' Anti-Scraper Systems Chris Siebenmann

üìÑ Multithreading in JavaScript with Web Workers Badmus Kola

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Svelte Flow 1.0: Create Node-Based UIs and Diagrams in Svelte ‚Äî From the creators of the similar React Flow comes a customizable Svelte component for building node-based editors and interactive diagrams. Want¬†examples?

webkid GmbH

Cap: A Lightweight, Modern Open Source CAPTCHA Alternative ‚Äî This solution boasts a method called ‚Äúproof-of-work‚Äù which attempts to make automated CAPTCHA solving more expensive. It uses a Web Component and you can try out a few demos here. GitHub¬†repo.

Cap

Enterprise Requirements Slowing You Down? There‚Äôs a Better Way ‚Äî WorkOS lets devs ship SSO, SCIM, audit logs & more‚Äîfast. Trusted by industry-leading teams like OpenAI, Vercel &¬†Plaid.

WorkOS sponsor

Google Gen AI SDK for TypeScript and JavaScript v1 ‚Äî Why let Python developers have all the fun? Now you can harness the full power of Google‚Äôs Gemini API (and Vertex platform) from Node.js¬†too.

Google

ReactJust: Server Components Without a Framework ‚Äî If, for some reason, you don‚Äôt want to adopt a full-scale framework like Next.js or React Router to use or experiment with RSCs, this ‚Äòvanilla RSC‚Äô approach could be of¬†interest.

almadoro

  • NeutralinoJS 6.1 ‚Äì Lightweight cross-platform desktop app¬†framework.

  • Linkify 4.3 ‚Äì Turn links, hashtags, and mentions in text to HTML¬†links.

  • image-type 6.0 ‚Äì Detect the image type of a Buffer/Uint8Array.

  • Faker 9.8 ‚Äì Generate fabricated data to your heart's¬†content.

  • file-type 21.0 ‚Äì Detect the file type of a file, stream, or¬†data.

  • Mineflayer 4.29 ‚Äì Create Minecraft bots in¬†JavaScript.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

How Notion‚Äôs engineering team tackled viral user growth to run PostgreSQL at scale on Amazon RDS with¬†pganalyze.

üëÄ¬† Elsewhere..

Here's a selection of things from the broader ecosystem this week:

  • The annual Stack Overflow Developer Survey is back for a fifteenth¬†year.

  • A Minecraft-style building experience in pure CSS ‚Äì no JavaScript at¬†all!

  • Simon Willison writes about how GitHub Issues works really well as a personal notebook for taking notes, linking them together, and generally organizing whatever sort of information you want. It doesn't have to just be for code¬†projects.

  • I just discovered that Matthias Bynens, who you might know for his work on everything V8, ECMAScript specs, and more, keeps a repo of the 'smallest possible syntactically valid files' in many different¬†formats.

  • Did you know you can style alt text like any other text on Web¬†pages?

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

Âú®ÁΩë‰∏äÈòÖËØª

ËøôÊòØÊú¨Âë®Êõ¥ÂπøÊ≥õÁöÑÁîüÊÄÅÁ≥ªÁªü‰∏≠ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õ‰∏úË•øÔºö

item.title: „ÄêBig Node, VS Code, and Mantine updates„ÄëÂ§ßËäÇÁÇπÔºåvs‰ª£Á†ÅÂíåÂ£ÅÁÇâÊõ¥Êñ∞
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã735 ‚Äî May 9, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

k6 1.0: Go-Powered Load Testing with JavaScript ‚Äî A full-featured, configurable load generation tool that uses the Sobek Go-powered JavaScript engine to support writing test scripts in JavaScript. v1.0 promises stability, first-class TypeScript support, and better¬†extensibility.

Grafana Labs

JSON-Powered White-Label Form Builder for Your JavaScript App ‚Äî Build dynamic JSON-driven forms in your JavaScript application with SurveyJS ‚Äî a fully customizable, drag-and-drop form-building UI component. It integrates seamlessly with React, Angular, and Vue 3, and has no backend limitations. Perfect for form-heavy¬†apps.

SurveyJS sponsor

Node 24 (Current) Released ‚Äî Node‚Äôs release lines are shifting a little lately ‚Äì v18 has gone EOL and now v23 gives way to v24 as the ‚ÄòCurrent‚Äô release for when you need the cutting edge features. It comes with npm 11, V8 13.6 (hello RegExp.escape, Float16Array, and Error.isError), the URLPattern API exposed by default, plus Undici¬†7.

Node.js Team

üí° Technically, Node v24.0.1 is the latest version temporarily reintroducing an EOL feature due to breakages in popular¬†dependencies.

Visual Studio Code Version 1.100 ‚Äî Not to be confused with a 1.1 release, this update to VS Code has quite a few goodies for JavaScript developers with improved ‚ÄòNext Edit Suggestions‚Äô that will suggest adding missing imports, support for Node‚Äôs enhanced network debugging capabilities, improved visibility of type information, remote MCP server support, GPT 4.1 as the new default base model, and¬†more.

Microsoft

IN BRIEF:

  • The Node.js team is keen for you to take the latest Node.js Next 10 survey to help guide Node's future¬†priorities.

  • Polycompiler uses a cute trick to let you merge Python and JavaScript into the same source¬†file.

  • The OpenJS Foundation has announced its new board of directors.

RELEASES:

  • ü§ñ ESLint v9.26.0 ‚Äì An interesting release for the popular static analysis tool as it adds support for MCP as a way for ESLint to be used directly by AI models and coding¬†agents.

  • üóæ Mapbox GL JS 3.12 ‚Äì Interactive, customizable vector maps in the browser, rendered with¬†WebGL.

  • Relay v19 ‚Äì Facebook's declarative React/GraphQL¬†framework.

  • Material UI 7.1 ‚Äì React components using Material¬†Design. Now Tailwind CSS¬†4¬†compatible

  • Rspack 1.3.9, Babylon.js 8.7, Electron 36 (official blog¬†post)

üìñ¬† Articles

The Power of the Spread and Rest Syntax ‚Äî A quick run through the opportunities opened up with just three little dots ...

Matt Smith

React Server Components for Astro Developers ‚Äî Astro‚Äôs ‚Äòisland‚Äô architecture and React Server Components share a strikingly similar mental model. Dan compares the two, digs into some of the quirks, and suggests Astro offers a ‚Äògentler onramp‚Äô to some of RSC‚Äôs ideas if you‚Äôre struggling with¬†them.

Dan Abramov

Wallaby MCP: Deep Runtime Context for Your AI Agent ‚Äî Wallaby gives your AI agent live execution data, dynamic coverage, and real-time insights to fix and generate tests, and write code with¬†confidence.

Wallaby Team sponsor

Migrating a Project from Prettier and ESLint to Biome ‚Äî Prettier and ESLint are staples in many JavaScript build processes, but Biome offers an interesting ‚Äòone stop shop‚Äô alternative.

Damilola Olatunji

üìÑ 'Electron Ain't Bad, Actually' ‚Äì Worth re-reading next time you see the clich√©d criticisms of¬†Electron. Vaxry

üì∫ The React Compiler Explained in Three Minutes Better Stack

üìÑ You're Misunderstanding DDD in Angular Tomasz Ducin

üìÑ The Story of Fastify + Vue Jonas Galvez

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

HelloCSV: A Drop-In, CSV Importing Workflow for JS Apps ‚Äî If you or your users have CSV files to import, here‚Äôs a complete CSV importing workflow for the frontend that you can drop into your app. Basic¬†docs.

HelloCSV

PptxGenJS 4.0: Build PowerPoint Presentations with JavaScript ‚Äî A mature library that outputs standards-compliant Open Office XML files compatible with PowerPoint, Apple Keynote, and other common presentation tools. Supports graphics, text, tables, and other typical slide objects. Lots of¬†demos.

Brent Ely

Introducing Clerk Billing ‚Äî Clerk Billing lets you add B2C/B2B subscriptions with no payment code or UI work‚Äîjust drop in components and¬†go.

Clerk sponsor

Mantine 8.0: The Full Featured React Components Library ‚Äî Mantine is one of the most celebrated React components libraries, and for good reason: it‚Äôs full featured, modern, and looks great. v8.0 ups its chart game with a little Recharts magic, adds over twenty new components (including a GitHub-style Heatmap, Tree and SemiCircleProgress), submenus, and much¬†more.

Vitaly Rtishchev et al.

Hyparquet: Parquet File Parser for JavaScript ‚Äî Parquet is a popular column-oriented data file format frequently used for storing large datasets for analysis. Hyparquet is a dependency-free JavaScript library for working with Parquet files, even in the browser (as in this¬†demo).

Hyperparam

üîä¬†react-sounds: Add Sound Effects to React Apps ‚Äî Having sound effects on the Web might sound like your idea of a nightmare, but this is a well put together project with delicate, well thought out examples that strike the right¬†tone.

Aedilic Inc.

mono-jsx: <html> as a Response ‚Äî A server-side JSX runtime that renders <html> to a Response with no build step needed and works across numerous server-side JS¬†runtimes.

Je Xia

  • Prisma v6.7 ‚Äì The popular ORM's attempts to move away from Rust to TypeScript are picking up¬†pace.

  • Slack Send GitHub Action 2.1 ‚Äì Send data into Slack from GitHub¬†Actions.

  • openid-client 6.5 ‚Äì OAuth 2/OpenID Connect client API for JS¬†runtimes.

  • üìÑ DOCX 9.5 ‚Äì Generate Word documents from¬†JavaScript.

  • eslint-plugin-prettier 5.4 ‚Äì Runs Prettier as an ESLint¬†rule.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

üïπÔ∏è Craft delightful games that change how the world learns as an engineer at Brilliant. Remote/NYC/SF:¬†brilliant.org/careers/

üëÄ¬† Elsewhere..

Here's a selection of things from the broader ecosystem we've noticed this week:

  • The CSS Overflow 5 spec enables the creation of pure CSS scroll and 'carousel' experiences on the Web, and Sara Soueidan has dug in deep and done an accessibility and usability analysis of the feature. Is it time to give up your JavaScript-based approach? Not yet, says¬†Sara.

  • Sam Rose is back with another fantastic visual essay - this time looking at 'reservoir sampling.' As well as getting to learn a useful programming technique in a visual way, you can also check out all the JavaScript code he built that powers the¬†article.

  • One team decided to move away from Next.js and migrate to Ruby on Rails, while still maintaining a React frontend ‚Äì here's their tale of why and how.

  • Postgres 18 Beta 1 was released. IO performance on Linux is a big¬†focus. The final release is due in September or¬†October.

  • ü§ñ Google has updated its Gemini 2.5 Pro model ‚Äì they claim it's now far better at building frontend apps in particular with 'a real taste for aesthetic web¬†development'.

P.S. If you're into React or Node.js, we focus more directly on those in React Status and Node Weekly respectively, so check out the latest issues of those too¬†:-)

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>
Âú®ÁΩë‰∏äÈòÖËØª

üìñarticles

- Âè™ÈúÄ‰∏â‰∏™Â∞èÁÇπ ...

- astro ÁöÑ'Island'ibell''Â≤õ'scholttect''ÂíåReactÊúçÂä°Âô®ÁªÑ‰ª∂ÈÉΩÂÖ∑ÊúâÊÉä‰∫∫ÁöÑÁ±ª‰ººÂøÉÁêÜÊ®°Âûã„ÄÇ‰∏πÂØπ‰∏§ËÄÖËøõË°åÊØîËæÉÔºåÊåñÊéòÂá∫‰∏Ä‰∫õÊÄ™ÁôñÔºåÂπ∂Âª∫ËÆÆÈòøÊñØÁâπÁΩóÔºàAstroÔºâ‰∏∫RSCÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õÊÉ≥Ê≥ïÊèê‰æõ‚ÄúÊõ¥Ê∏©ÂíåÁöÑon ramp‚Äù„ÄÇ

Dan Abramov

wallaby mcpÔºöai‰ª£ÁêÜÁöÑÊ∑±Â∫¶ËøêË°åÊó∂‰∏ä‰∏ãÊñá - wallabyÂÖÅËÆ∏ÊÇ®ÁöÑAI AgentÂÆûÊó∂ÊâßË°åÊï∞ÊçÆÔºåÂä®ÊÄÅË¶ÜÁõñËåÉÂõ¥ÂíåÂÆûÊó∂Ê¥ûÂØüÂäõÔºå‰ª•Ëß£ÂÜ≥ÂíåÁîüÊàêÊµãËØïÔºåÂπ∂ÁΩÆ‰ø°Â§Ñ„ÄÇ

„ÄÇ

wallabyÂõ¢Èòü

- Âú®ËÆ∏Â§öJavaScriptÊûÑÂª∫ËøáÁ®ã‰∏≠ÔºåÊõ¥ÊºÇ‰∫Æ‰∏îEslintÊòØ‰∏ªÈ£üÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØ damilola olatunji

üìÑ vaxry

üì∫üìÑüìÑ

mono-jsx: as a Response ‚Äî A server-side JSX runtime that renders to a Response with no build step needed and works across numerous server-side JS¬†runtimes.

je xia

  • üìÑ

üì∞ÂàÜÁ±ª

item.title: „ÄêA timeline of JavaScript's history„ÄëJavaScriptÂéÜÂè≤ÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥Ë°®
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã737 ‚Äî May 23, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

A Brief History of JavaScript ‚Äî JavaScript (originally named LiveScript) turns thirty years old this year and the Deno team has put together a fantastic timeline-based tour of how much things have progressed from its first appearance in Netscape Navigator, through offshoots like JScript, standardization, and the introduction of Node.js, all the way through to the modern¬†day.

The Deno Team

2x-40x Faster Docker Builds with Blacksmith ‚Äî With a one-line code change, Blacksmith can make your Docker builds incremental by mounting your Docker layer cache into your GitHub Actions runner. Blacksmith is used by 600+ companies like Ashby, Clerk, and¬†Mintlify.

Blacksmith sponsor

‚ö°¬†Announcing TypeScript Native Previews ‚Äî Earlier this year, Anders Hejlsberg teased a 10x faster TypeScript through efforts being made to port the TypeScript compiler to Go, enabling it to be compiled and run natively, as well as take advantage of more concurrency. The good news is you can now give it a.. go for¬†yourself.

Microsoft

‚ñ∂¬†¬†An Introduction to JavaScript Frameworks ‚Äî The creator of SolidJS has put together a tight 11-minute video boiling down the different approaches taken by React, Angular, Vue, Svelte, and Solid. Dense, but a great way to get a lay of the¬†land.

Ryan Carniato

IN BRIEF:

  • Ryan Dahl responds to recent community chatter about the state of the Deno project in 'Reports of Deno's Demise Have Been Greatly Exaggerated'.

  • Guess the Output is a fun multi-choice JavaScript quiz to put your knowledge to the test. Each answer is explained as you¬†go.

  • A look at the agenda for next week's TC39 meeting, including the proposals up for¬†discussion.

  • React Router now has preview support for React Server Components.

RELEASES:

  • Node.js v24.1.0 (Current) and v22.16.0 (LTS)

  • Bun v1.2.14 ‚Äì The fast JS runtime &¬†toolkit.

  • Slonik v48 ‚Äì Node.js Postgres client with runtime & build time type¬†safety.

  • Zod v4, Astro 5.8, ESLint v9.27.0

üìñ¬† Articles

‚ñ∂¬†¬†What's New in Angular ‚Äî Two members of the Angular team presented a session at this week‚Äôs Google I/O event on the latest updates to the Angular framework in anticipation of the eventual release of Angular 20 next¬†Thursday.

Chasanoff and Thompson (Google)

ESLint v9.0: A Retrospective ‚Äî It‚Äôs been a year since ESLint v9.0 landed as the first major release in a few years. It enabled the new flat-config system by default and the rollout didn‚Äôt go as smoothly as hoped. This retrospective breaks down the full story and shares the lessons¬†learned.

Nicholas C. Zakas

Getting Started with Clerk Billing ‚Äî Learn how to build a complete billing experience with Clerk and Stripe, no custom UI or webhooks¬†required.

Clerk sponsor

Six Ways Slack, Notion, and VS Code Improved Electron App Performance ‚Äî An experienced Electron app developer shares a guide to Electron performance optimization and how to get the most out of your¬†apps.

Amila Welihinda

üìÑ How the at() Method Makes Array Indexing Easier Matt Smith

üìÑ Styling Console Text in Node.js Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

üìÑ Authenticating JavaScript WebSockets Steven Waterman

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Defuddle: Extract the Main Content from Web Pages ‚Äî Strips extraneous clutter from HTML in order to leave only the primary content for you to format or use as you wish. Essentially a modern implementation of the ideas behind Mozilla‚Äôs Readability. There‚Äôs an online demo if you want to give it a¬†try.

Steph Ango

snapDOM: Captures DOM Nodes as Images ‚Äî A fast and accurate DOM-to-image capture mechanism to capture any HTML element as a scalable SVG image, preserving styles, fonts, background images, etc.

ZumerLab

AI-Powered Code Reviews for JavaScript Teams ‚Äî CodeRabbit helps you ship cleaner JavaScript by reviewing every PR with AI that understands your¬†codebase.

CodeRabbit sponsor

ForesightJS: Predictive Mouse Intent Library ‚Äî An interesting concept, with the entire page acting as a demo of sorts. The idea is to decrease latency by prefetching data or pages as soon as you think a user might be heading in that direction. Your mileage may vary and it‚Äôs less useful for touch¬†devices.

ForesightJS, Inc.

Astra: A New JavaScript-to-EXE Compiler for Windows ‚Äî Boasts ‚Äúa new approach to compiling‚Äù JavaScript applications for a single executable experience on Windows only (for¬†now).

QwertyCodeQC

Crosspost: A JS Utility for Posting Across Multiple Social Networks ‚Äî Currently supports eight different services including Bluesky, X, Mastodon, and¬†LinkedIn.

Nicholas C. Zakas

Rockpack 6.0: An Alternative React App Starter ‚Äî A tool aiming to get React project setup time as low as possible, complete with server side rendering support, bundling, linting and testing. v6.0 updates everything for React 19. GitHub¬†repo.

Alex Sergey

  • üóìÔ∏è Calendar Link 2.10.0 ‚Äì Generate event links for popular calendar¬†services.

  • octokit.js 5.0 ‚Äì 'All-batteries-included' GitHub SDK for JavaScript.

  • image-type 6.0 ‚Äì Detect the image type of a Buffer/Uint8Array.

  • Peggy 5.0 ‚Äì Parser generator for¬†JavaScript.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

Build a professional design system in less than a day, using Hope AI, new model by Bit.Cloud. Enjoy reusable UI components ready for¬†import.

üëÄ¬† Elsewhere..

Here's a selection of things from the broader ecosystem this week:

  • Google's I/O event took place this week and ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†its 'developer keynote' was a highlight, particularly when Addy Osmani showed off some of the latest Chrome DevTools fun (starting at about 30 minutes in).

  • Microsoft has unveiled a new Postgres extension for VS Code that brings IntelliSense completion to SQL, GitHub Copilot integration, a visual way to explore your schemas, and¬†more.

  • ü§ñ Anthropic has unveiled its new Claude 4 models. The Claude family of LLMs are quite heavily used by modern coding agents, as well as Claude's own now-generally-available Claude Code tool.

  • The Glitch platform, a popular way to build and host Node-backed webapps, is shutting down its app hosting functionality ‚Äì it seems uncertain quite what Glitch will or won't be after¬†July.

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

Âú®ÁΩë‰∏äÈòÖËØª

üìñarticles

‚ñ∂ - AngularÂõ¢ÈòüÁöÑ‰∏§ÂêçÊàêÂëòÂú®Êú¨Âë®ÁöÑGoogle I/OÊ¥ªÂä®‰∏ä‰ªãÁªç‰∫ÜAngular FrameworkÁöÑÊúÄÊñ∞Êõ¥Êñ∞Ôºå‰ª•ÊúüÊúÄÁªàÂèëÂ∏ÉAngular 20‰∏ãÂë®Âõõ„ÄÇ

ChasanoffÂíåThompsonÔºàGoogleÔºâ

- Ëá™Eslint V9.0ÁôªÈôÜ‰ª•Êù•Â∑≤ÁªèÊòØÂá†Âπ¥Êù•ÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∏ªË¶ÅÁâàÊú¨Â∑≤Áªè‰∏ÄÂπ¥‰∫Ü„ÄÇÈªòËÆ§ÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÔºåÂÆÉÂêØÁî®‰∫ÜÊñ∞ÁöÑFlat-ConfigÁ≥ªÁªüÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÊé®Âá∫Âπ∂Ê≤°ÊúâÂÉèÂ∏åÊúõÁöÑÈÇ£Ê†∑È°∫Âà©ËøõË°å„ÄÇËøôÁßçÂõûÈ°æÊÄßÊâìÁ†¥‰∫ÜÊï¥‰∏™ÊïÖ‰∫ãÂπ∂ÂàÜ‰∫´‰∫ÜÁªèÈ™åÊïôËÆ≠„ÄÇ

Nicholas C. Zakas

- Â≠¶‰π†Â¶Ç‰Ωï‰ΩøÁî®ÊñáÂëòÂíåÊù°Á∫πÂª∫Á´ãÂÆåÊï¥ÁöÑËÆ°Ë¥π‰ΩìÈ™åÔºåÊó†ÈúÄËá™ÂÆö‰πâUIÊàñWebhooks„ÄÇ

Â∫óÂëò

<Ë∑®Â∫¶Ê†∑Âºè=‚Äú font-weightÔºö600; font-sizeÔºö1.1em; colorÔºöÔºÉ000;‚Äú> - ÁªèÈ™å‰∏∞ÂØåÁöÑÁîµÂ≠êÂ∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫èÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫ÂëòÂàÜ‰∫´‰∫ÜÁîµÂ≠êÊÄßËÉΩ‰ºòÂåñÊåáÂçó‰ª•ÂèäÂ¶Ç‰Ωï‰ªéÂ∫îÁî®‰∏≠Ëé∑ÂæóÊúÄÂ§ßÊî∂Áõä„ÄÇ

Amila Welihinda

üìÑüìÑ

üìÑ

üëÄÂÖ∂‰ªñÂú∞Êñπ..

ËøôÊòØÊú¨Âë®Êõ¥ÂπøÊ≥õÁöÑÁîüÊÄÅÁ≥ªÁªü‰∏≠ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õ‰∏úË•øÔºö

  • GoogleÁöÑ‚ñ∂qus'ÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫Âëò‰∏ªÈ¢òÊºîËÆ≤'ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∫ÆÁÇπÔºåÂ∞§ÂÖ∂ÊòØÂΩìAddy OsmaniÂ±ïÁ§∫‰∏Ä‰∫õÊúÄÊñ∞ÁöÑChrome DevTools Fun Êó∂Ôºà‰ªéÂ§ßÁ∫¶30ÂàÜÈíüÂºÄÂßãÔºâ„ÄÇ

  • MicrosoftÂ∑≤ÂÖ¨Â∏É

  • ü§ñÊãü‰∫∫ÂåñÂÖ∑ÊúâClaude Code tool.

  • glitch Âπ≥Âè∞ÊòØ‰∏ÄÁßçÊûÑÂª∫Âíå‰∏ªÊú∫ËäÇÁÇπÊîØÊåÅÁöÑÁΩëÁªúÂ∫îÁî®ÁöÑÊµÅË°åÊñπÂºèÔºåÊòØ

item.title: „ÄêThe power of generators„ÄëÂèëÁîµÊú∫ÁöÑÂäõÈáè
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã736 ‚Äî May 16, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

'I Think the Ergonomics of Generators is Growing on Me' ‚Äî The author notes generator functions have been widely available in JavaScript for a long time, yet ‚Äútheir practicality hasn‚Äôt exactly caught on.‚Äù This is a great look at what they are and where they can be¬†useful.

Alex MacArthur

JavaScript's New Superpower? Explicit Resource Management ‚Äî V8 v13.8 introduces the idea of deterministic resource cleanup. Among a range of new symbols and objects for the task, the basic idea is you can wrap any file handle, stream or connection in a using/await using block and the runtime will handle any cleanup once resources go out of¬†scope.

Rezvan Mahdavi Hezaveh (V8)

Write CSS Like a Pro ‚Äî Kevin Powell shares how to create a responsive website from scratch using modern CSS features (such as nesting, utility classes, custom properties, and more). This detailed video course also dives into adding additional polish via animations, view transitions, and¬†more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Basecoat: shadcn/ui's Magic, But Minus React ‚Äî shadcn/ui is a popular suite of well designed React components, but if you‚Äôd like to use them in other contexts too, Basecoat is for you. Basecoat ports the components to a more vanilla form you can use with your framework (or not) of¬†choice.

Ronan Berder

IN BRIEF:

  • Did you know that console.log supports format strings? I¬†didn't!

  • The Deno team shares an update on the Fresh framework.

  • The Angular team is teasing the release of Angular 20 to be on May 29, but we might learn a lot more at Google I/O next week. I'm going to be there, say hi if you see me!¬†:-)

  • Microsoft announced a round of layoffs this week and, much to the community‚Äôs disappointment, Ron Buckton, a key TypeScript contributor, was among those¬†affected.

  • Brian Clark shares some best practices for creating a modern npm¬†package.

RELEASES:

  • May 14 Security Releases of Node.js ‚Äì Including v24.0.2 (Current), v23.11.1 (Current), v22.15.1 (LTS), and v20.19.2 (LTS).

  • Nuxt 3.17 ‚Äì The full-stack Vue.js-based framework.

  • Parcel v2.15.0 ‚Äì The popular build tool gets a new transformer and minifier for HTML and SVG that also supports converting SVGs to JSX for use in React¬†components.

  • React Router 7.6, MUI X 8.3, Mithril.js 2.3

üìñ¬† Articles

JavaScript, When (and What) is this? ‚Äî Dives into the complexities of the this keyword, explaining how its value is ultimately determined by the context in which a function is called, rather than where it‚Äôs defined. It‚Äôs been many years since we‚Äôve covered this elementary topic, but this is a fantastic, fresh two-part¬†take.

Mat 'Wilto' Marquis

How We Debugged a Broken Checkout Flow in Flask + React ‚Äî Dropped carts = lost revenue. See how Sentry tracing can catch a full-stack bug in a Flask + React checkout flow‚Äîbefore it can become a support fire¬†drill.

Sentry sponsor

Building a React App with GitHub Copilot ‚Äî A good walkthrough, complete with video, if you prefer, of bringing together several of GitHub Copilot‚Äôs features for building a modern JavaScript app¬†quickly.

Kedasha Kerr (GitHub)

Regular Expressions in JavaScript ‚Äî Powerful but often misunderstood, many will benefit from this roundup of the potential regexes offer to JavaScript¬†developers.

Adebayo Adams

üìÑ Robust Data Fetching Architecture for Complex React/Next.js Apps Trevor I. Lasn

‚ñ∂Ô∏è Native and RxJS Observables: A Direct Comparison Rainer Hahnekamp

üìÑ Angular's httpResource in the Wild ‚Äì A modern way to make HTTP requests in¬†Angular. DrDreo

üìÑ Node.js 24 is Here: What You Need to¬†Know Lizz Parody

üìÑ Building the Bridge: Running JavaScript Modules from Dart Chima Precious

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

ANSIS 4.0: ANSI Color Library for Everywhere ‚Äî A library to use the power of ANSI escape sequences for coloring and styling text in many environments including the terminal, Chromium-based browsers, Node, Bun, Deno, and even Next.js. v4.0 is a big upgrade with enough breaking changes to warrant a migration guide for existing¬†users.

webdiscus

TanStack DB: A Reactive Client Store with Fast Real-Time Sync ‚Äî A new entry to the TanStack family of libraries that extends TanStack Query with collections, live queries and optimistic¬†mutations.

TanStack

Introducing Clerk Billing ‚Äî Set up subscriptions in your B2B or B2C app without writing custom payment code or building your own¬†UI.

Clerk sponsor

Svelte Sonner: A Toast Notification Component for Svelte ‚Äî You may be familiar with the fantastic Sonner in the React world ‚Äì now there‚Äôs a Svelte¬†version.

Robert Soriano

tscircuit: Use React for Building Electronics¬†Projects ‚Äî An interesting way to design and lay out electronic circuit boards using a JSX-based approach. GitHub¬†repo.

tscircuit Inc.

jsdiff 8.0: A JavaScript Text Diffing Implementation ‚Äî Can compare strings for differences in various ways including creating patches. There‚Äôs an online¬†demo.

Kevin Decker

Feedsmith: A Fresh New Web Feed Parser and Generator ‚Äî A new, modern way to both parse and generate RSS, Atom, JSON Feed, OPML, and RDF feeds with support for common namespaces as used in podcast, media, and other niche types of feed.

Maciej Lamberski

  • Faker 9.8 ‚Äì Generate fabricated data to your heart's¬†content.

  • ngx-vflow 1.8 ‚Äì Angular library to create node-based¬†apps.

  • üé® color-convert 3.1 ‚Äì Plain color conversion functions.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

Build a professional design system in less than a day, using Hope AI, new model by Bit.Cloud. Enjoy reusable UI components ready for¬†import.

üëÄ¬†This could be useful..

Fx 36.0: A Command-Line JSON Viewer & Processing Tool ‚Äî It's written in Go, but if you‚Äôve got some files full of JSON that you want to slice and dice, Fx is for you (it's easy to install). This week's v36 release adds support for streaming JSON and tailing such streams, it‚Äôs also much faster and less memory hungry when parsing large JSON files. A solid update for a handy¬†tool.

Anton Medvedev

P.S. If you're into React or Node.js, we focus more directly on those in React Status and Node Weekly respectively, so check out the latest issues of those too¬†:-)

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

üìñarticles

Ê≠§Ôºü - Ê∑±ÂÖ•Ê≠§ÂÖ≥ÈîÆÂ≠óÁöÑÂ§çÊùÇÊÄßÔºåËß£Èáä‰∫ÜÂÖ∂ÂÄºÊúÄÁªàÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÁî±Ë∞ÉÁî®ÂáΩÊï∞ÁöÑ‰∏ä‰∏ãÊñáÊù•Á°ÆÂÆöÔºåËÄå‰∏çÊòØÂÆö‰πâÂÖ∂ÂÆö‰πâÁöÑ‰ΩçÁΩÆ„ÄÇËá™‰ªéÊàë‰ª¨Êä•ÈÅì‰∫ÜËøô‰∏™Âü∫Êú¨ËØùÈ¢ò‰ª•Êù•Â∑≤ÁªèÊúâÂæàÂ§öÂπ¥‰∫ÜÔºå‰ΩÜËøôÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂæàÊ£íÁöÑÊñ∞È≤úÁöÑ‰∏§ÈÉ®ÂàÜ„ÄÇ

Mat'Wilto'Marquis

- ÊéâËêΩÁöÑË¥≠Áâ©ËΩ¶=ÊçüÂ§±ÁöÑÊî∂ÂÖ•„ÄÇÊü•ÁúãÂì®ÂÖµË∑üË∏™Â¶Ç‰ΩïÂú®ÁÉßÁì∂‰∏≠ÊçïËé∑ÂÖ®Â†ÜÊ†àÈîôËØØ + ReactÁªìÂ∏êÊµÅÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÂÆÉÂèØ‰ª•Êàê‰∏∫ÊîØÊíëÂºèÊ∂àÈò≤Êºî‰π†„ÄÇ

Anton Medvedev

P.S„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÊÇ®ÂñúÊ¨¢reactÊàñnode.jsÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰ºöÊõ¥Áõ¥Êé•Âú∞ÂÖ≥Ê≥®
